image.altText: A Localcoin branded Bitcoin ATM.

props.synopsis: There are dozens of cryptocurrency ATMs in the Canberra region, located across the city and outside it — but what are they for, how have they become so prolific, and who uses them?

title.children: 'Wild west of finance': Why are there cryptocurrency ATMs?

image.altText: A graphic depicts traditional Korean hanbok alongside a Chinese garment and the War Memorial building

props.synopsis: A garment that appears to be of Chinese origin is currently displayed in front of the South Korean flag at the Australian War Memorial — something Korean Australians are demanding is rectified.

title.children: Korean community call on Australian War Memorial to fix 'misleading' display

image.altText: Jacob Vadakkedathu, Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: The Liberals lead Senate candidate for Canberra faces a vote to be disendorsed after being called in for a meeting over claims of branch stacking.

title.children: Liberal Senate candidate faces vote to be disendorsed

image.altText: A man in a blue and white checked button down shirt stands in a mechanic's garage full of buses.

props.synopsis: The manufacturer of four electric buses temporarily pulled from Canberra's public service fleet say the ACT government never raised concerns about the vehicles' range despite citing it as a key reason the vehicles were taken off the roads.

title.children: 'No reports of range concerns' in EV buses pulled from Canberra roads

image.altText: Empty desks on the CommSec trading floor, including social distancing signs

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission found the man, who believed Microsoft Teams amounted to "illegal video surveillance", had not been bullied at work.

title.children: Lawyer who claimed Microsoft Teams was 'illegal video surveillance' has bullying claim rejected

image.altText: Branches on the road after storms tore them down.

props.synopsis: A major clean-up effort is underway across the ACT and surrounds after a severe thunderstorm on Wednesday night pulled down trees, flooded homes and cut power to hundreds of properties.

title.children: Hail 'as big as golf balls' and thunder strikes Canberra with 110kph wind gusts

image.altText: A yellow 'road closed' sign across a road with clothing and other items scattered in the background.

props.synopsis: A motorist who allegedly hit and killed a pedestrian in Jerrabomberra late last year has been charged with causing death by dangerous and negligent driving.

title.children: Woman charged over fatal Jerrabomberra crash that killed mother-of-two

image.altText: Six different hands reach towards a contactless pay point on public transport, each paying in a different way.

props.synopsis: Transport Canberra's new ticketing system was intended to make paying for and planning routes on public transport easier, but almost two months since its rollout some commuters are still struggling to navigate MyWay+.

title.children: 'Still not ready': Commuters struggling to navigate MyWay+

image.altText: A Facebook logo seen displayed on a smartphone

props.synopsis: Many people sign up for Facebook groups to find a like-minded community. But sometimes things aren't as they appear. Here's what to look out for.

title.children: Inside the world of monetised Facebook groups, and what to look out for

image.altText: Coco Gauff holding her head in her hands, embarassed, while answering questions on court from Jelena Dokic

props.synopsis: Coco Gauff discusses using the bathroom while wearing her outfit, Paula Badosa offers her boyfriend the chance to do better, and a young fan warms hearts in Melbourne. Here are the five quick hits from day six of the Australian Open.

title.children: Quick hits: Coco reveals too much and a lovers' tiff sparks fightback

image.altText: Danielle Collins cups her hand to her left ear

props.synopsis: Tennis purists felt unsettled as Danielle Collins went right at a rowdy Australian crowd after taking out a hometown favourite in incredible scenes. But the exchange is actually healthy for the sport.

title.children: Collins's feud with fans lit up the Aus Open and tennis is better off for it

image.altText: storm front that hit Gungahlin, Canberra Jan 15

props.synopsis: Australia's summer weather is firing on all cylinders this weekend, with severe storms in the east set to make way for heatwaves in the west, and what could be the first cyclone to form near mainland Australia this season.

title.children: Fresh round of heatwaves expected to spread from west to east next week

image.altText: 2025-01-16T205239Z_932871574_RC2JACAHWXKD_RTRMADP_3_USA-TRUMP-STATES-LAWSUITS

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's inauguration ceremony will be moved indoors as freezing cold temperatures are forecast to hit Washington DC this weekend.

title.children: Trump inauguration moved indoors due to cold weather

image.altText: Joe Biden sits at a desk, with flags, framed photos and gold curtains in the background.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden's presidency has featured some notable successes, a series of blunders and plain bad luck.

title.children: Wins, gaffes and miscalculations: Reflecting on Joe Biden's presidency

image.altText: Lisa standing in grassland, with native trees behind her.

props.synopsis: In the middle of Tasmania sits a 5,000-hectare property once used for sheep grazing. But when the sheep farmers left, an unlikely buyer moved in.

title.children: Billionaire couple focus their fortune on conservation — and profit

image.altText: Crews clean up red paint splashed at a house in Dover Heights in an anti-Semitic attack

props.synopsis: On Friday, anti-Semitic graffiti was reported in Sydney. Hours later, Islamophobic graffiti was found. Jewish historians say the trend is in line with a complex issue underlying Australian society.

title.children: As discriminatory vandalism sweeps Australia, what's behind this trend?

image.altText: A model of a brain

props.synopsis: About 2,000 people in Australia are affected by Huntington's disease, a fatal and incurable condition that affects the nervous system that results in the death of brain cells.

title.children: Research reveals 'ticking DNA clock' behind Huntington's disease

image.altText: Image of red Tasmanian cherries next to a box of ripe lychees.

props.synopsis: Australian fruit producers are gearing up for Lunar New Year. At the centre of these celebrations are North Queensland lychees and Tasmanian cherries, which serve as symbols of prosperity and good fortune in Asian culture.

title.children: Why Lunar New Year has driven up fruit prices

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A photo shows a plane flying toward the Eiffel Tower

props.synopsis: Pakistan's national airline has apologised for the advertisement, which is still online more than a week after it was first posted.

title.children: 'We truly apologise': Pakistan's national airline says sorry over Eiffel Tower advert

image.altText: Man making a phone call

props.synopsis: It has been more than 80 days since Telstra and Optus flicked the switch on the 3G mobile network. Hundreds of regional and remote Australians say they can no longer rely on the network and struggle to make calls.

title.children: Hundreds complain about failing mobile phone service since 3G switched off

image.altText: dog flickr

props.synopsis: The five-week-old died from fatal injuries after a mauling from a family pet in the Central Coast in 2021.

title.children: NSW coroner calls for dog owners to be licensed after baby mauled to death

image.altText: A Chinese man posing topless while wearing black shorts in a gym with a wall decorated with balloons

props.synopsis: Chinese authorities have reportedly rescued a Chinese model who was caught up in a human-trafficking ring in Myanmar's lawless borderlands.

title.children: Chinese model rescued from scam centre in Myanmar

image.altText: Part of a house on it's side between other properties.

props.synopsis: After a $2 million property lay in a splintered heap near the foot of a Mornington Peninsula hill on Tuesday, questions have been raised about the long-term viability of home lending and insurance for hilltop neighbourhoods.

title.children: This Victorian hillside home sold for $2 million. Now it lies in splinters

image.altText: a boy wearing tradesman yellow hi-vis clothing and a heat looks back at the camera while in the car

props.synopsis: Teenagers across Australia can get their probationary licence at 16 or 17, but in Victoria, learner permit holders have to wait until they're 18. Some say the law is out of step.

title.children: Push to lower driving age in Victoria as P-platers complain of job hurdles

image.altText: IMAGE Stallone, Voight, Gibson composite

props.synopsis: President-elect Donald Trump has tapped Sylvester Stallone, Mel Gibson and Jon Voight to be his "eyes and ears" in Hollywood.

title.children: Trump names trio of action stars as Hollywood 'special ambassadors'

image.altText: Debris from the roof is collected in a grand stand at a stadium

props.synopsis: A vinyl sheet of roofing has fallen into the stands at the SCG amid wild winds that blew across the ground before the Sydney Sixers' Big Bash League clash with the Sydney Thunder.

title.children: Debris falls from SCG roof as wild weather washes out BBL clash

image.altText: People standing on the beach behind tents in central Gaza.

props.synopsis: Palestinians in Gaza could soon leave their makeshift camps and tents behind under a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas. But after 15 months of war, many will be returning to rubble where their homes once stood.

title.children: Before and after images show what Gazans will be returning home to

image.altText: Farmer in bucket hat on sugar cane farm looking to right of frame

props.synopsis: If the monsoon does not arrive by January 25, it will be the latest since records began. Farmer Mark Savina, who's seeing good growth in his sugar cane, certainly doesn't mind.

title.children: How farmers, tradies in northern Australia are making the most of a late monsoon

image.altText: Elizabeth Dalman spreads her arms wide as she stands in front of ADT dancers

props.synopsis: Modern dance pioneer and rebel Elizabeth Dalman is returning to her roots in a new production by a leading Australian arts company.

title.children: 90-year-old rebel with a cause returns for new dance show

image.altText: A headshot of Imran Khan in front of a flag

props.synopsis: Khan is accused of accepting a gift of land from a real estate tycoon in exchange for laundered money when he was in power.

title.children: Pakistani court sentences ex-prime minister Imran Khan to 14 years in prison

image.altText: A sign near a building entrance that says "National Capital Private Hospital''. A van is parked in the background.

props.synopsis: Healthscope is set to tear up its contract with Bupa in around a month if the two parties don't reach an agreement — a move that will impact millions of its members.

title.children: Millions face hospital costs as Healthscope dispute with insurers stalls

image.altText: Rider Daniel Sanders on his motorcycle, one wheel in the air, during a rally

props.synopsis: Daniel Sanders has raced into the history books, becoming only the second Australian to triumph at the Dakar Rally.

title.children: Sanders becomes second Aussie to win famous Dakar Rally

image.altText: SpaceX Starship on launch pad

props.synopsis: A SpaceX prototype has failed in space after its launch caused weeks of Qantas flight delays.

title.children: SpaceX prototype fails in space after launch caused string of Qantas delays
